meanings.definition: past tense of party: to engage in social activities, often involving drinking and dancing
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we partied all night long with our friends.
meanings.sent2: She partied with her classmates after the school play.
meanings.sent3: The cat partied around the house, chasing shadows.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to have partied all night, twinkling brightly.
meanings.sent5: The city streets were alive with music as people partied joyfully.

meanings.definition: past participle of party: having participated in social activities
meanings.sent1: The tired, but happy, group of partied friends left the club.
meanings.sent2: She was a partied guest at the extravagant wedding.
meanings.sent3: The partied balloons floated lazily in the room after the celebration.
meanings.sent4: The partied room was filled with laughter and memories.
meanings.sent5: The partied decorations added a festive touch to the event.

meanings.definition: plural noun: a group of people gathered for socializing and celebration
meanings.sent1: The partied were still chatting and laughing in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: We joined the partied at the beach bonfire.
meanings.sent3: The partied in the park had a picnic under the trees.
meanings.sent4: The partied at the concert were having a great time.
meanings.sent5: The partied in the restaurant raised their glasses in a toast.
